CatDescriptText: Mrs. Ruth Smith, 3008 Camp Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 18, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think the Federal Government should immediately enforce the Supreme Court's recent decision in 'Little Rock School Case' or permit the recalcitrant states to take their time in obeying?" answer reads: "I think that it should be enforced immediately. I think we have waited long enough.  This is supposed to be a free America, and since it is a free America, we should be allowed the privileges of other Americans.  Why does the color of the skin make a difference?  It shouldn't."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ruth Smith wearing earrings, eyeglasses, necklace, and light colored gloves, standing in front of swirled granite and light colored tile building, Wood Street, Downtown
